channel.title: retrocomputing on Cortically Magnified
channel.description: Recent content in retrocomputing on Cortically Magnified

item.title: Which department threw out a freaking VAX?
item.description: On university corridors, you inevitably see old equipments lying around. But which department threw out an entire freaking VAX? Those must be the famous “blinkenlights”…

item.title: The old man and the vacuum tubes
item.description: During a trip to Tokyo in 2013, I found an opportunity to visit the Akihabara district. This area is world famous for its high concentration of shops selling the latest models of computers, game consoles, gadgets, and other geeky items. I was, however, pleasantly surprised that, like almost everywhere else in Tokyo, traces of postwar Japan are never too distant away. Hidden behind tall buildings are two narrow lanes of traditional shops selling electronics parts.
